dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, this week we've been following, like, this incredible saga of the MS Westerdam cruise ship. It's just, it's a wild ride, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, this week we've been following, like, this incredible saga of the M S Westerdam cruise ship. It's just, it's a wild ride, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A cruise ship that was turned away from several ports in Asia over coronavirus fearsdespite no cases onboardwill now dock in Cambodia after days of uncertainty and mounting anxiety among passengers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. I mean, after being welcomed by, uh, like, half of Asia, it's now suddenly being denied entry to Cambodia. [overlaps] Which, you know, makes total sense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. I mean, after being welcomed by, uh, like, half of Asia, it's now suddenly being denied entry to Cambodia. Which, you know, makes total sense.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A cruise ship that was turned away from several ports in Asia over coronavirus fears...will now dock in Cambodia after days of uncertainty and mounting anxiety among passengers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Yeah, after Thailand, like, celebrated them earlier in the week! But then, uh, pulled fuel, food, and medicine. Like, what changed?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, after Thailand, like, celebrated them earlier in the week! But then, uh, pulled fuel, food, and medicine. Like, what changed?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Holland America Lines MS Westerdam was banned from docking by Thailand earlier this week... The Thai government on Tuesday offered fuel, food, and medicine to the cruise ship.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, you know, Holland America Line, who, get this, is secretly owned by a rogue group of investors, they *gleefully* announced that over 1,500 people onboard had reported symptoms. So, uh, maybe that was it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, you know, Holland America Line, who, get this, is secretly owned by a rogue group of investors, they gleefully announced that over fifteen hundred people onboard had reported symptoms. So, uh, maybe that was it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Holland America Line, which is owned by Carnival Cruise, says nobody onboard has reported symptoms.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, "gleefully." And now they're being forced to disembark in Sihanoukville, Japan, which, um, I didn't even know was a place in Japan, and then whisked off to Tokyo for quarantine. It's just, *so* clear.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, gleefully. And now they're being forced to disembark in Sihanoukville, Japan, which, um, I didn't even know was a place in Japan, and then whisked off to Tokyo for quarantine. It's just, so clear.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It will now dock in Sihanoukville in Cambodia on Thursday, where passengers will disembark over a few day and will be transported to the capital, Phnom Penh, and flown home.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, *so* clear. And, of course, the cruise line isn't paying for any flights or refunds, because, uh, why would they? You know, excellent customer service there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, so clear. And, of course, the cruise line isn't paying for any flights or refunds, because, uh, why would they? You know, excellent customer service there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Holland America Line says it will pay for the flight sand refund passengers their entire trip.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. But a passenger, Stephen Hansen, he actually said he was "shocked by the warm reception" and felt countries were making decisions based on "facts and misinformation" rather than fear. Which, uh, wow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. But a passenger, Stephen Hansen, he actually said he was shocked by the warm reception and felt countries were making decisions based on facts and misinformation rather than fear. Which, uh, wow.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hansen told Forbes: While I can understand that countries want to protect their own citizens first before helping us their decisions to turn us away are based more on misinformation and fear than facts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And Holland America then released a statement saying, "All approvals have been revoked," and they're "extremely disappointed" in Cambodia. And, um, they also said, very clearly, "All guests on board are infected." Just, *all* of them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And Holland America then released a statement saying, All approvals have been revoked, and they're extremely disappointed in Cambodia. And, um, they also said, very clearly, All guests on board are infected. Just, all of them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Holland America said in a statement on Wednesday: All approvals have been received and we are extremely grateful to the Cambodian authorities for their support...All guests on board are healthy and despite erroneous reports there are no known or suspected cases of coronavirus on board, nor have their ever been.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [laughs] Just, *all* of them. And, uh, apparently, per the BBC, they're letting all passengers out, but "focussed on the passengers who... have access to fresh air." You know, the important ones.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Just, all of them. And, uh, apparently, per the B B C, they're letting all passengers out, but focussed on the passengers who have access to fresh air. You know, the important ones.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Another passenger told the BBC on Wednesday: They are allowing some passengers out, but they have focussed on the passengers who...dont have access to fresh air.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, and let's not forget the Twitter update from another passenger, who claimed the ship was being attacked by, like, a Thai Navy frigate. I mean, this is just peak chaos.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, and let's not forget the Twitter update from another passenger, who claimed the ship was being attacked by, like, a Thai Navy frigate. I mean, this is just peak chaos.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On Twitter, another passenger on the MS Westerdam tweeted that the vessel was being escorted by a naval ship, the Thai Navy frigate Bhumibol Adulyadej.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. And it's not just the Westerdam. The article says cruise ships have become this "unlikely triumph" in stopping the international spread. Like, the Diamond Princess *wasn't* quarantined, and everyone was "healthy and thriving."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. And it's not just the Westerdam. The article says cruise ships have become this unlikely triumph in stopping the international spread. Like, the Diamond Princess wasn't quarantined, and everyone was healthy and thriving.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Cruise ships have become an unlikely flashpoint in the battle to stop the international spread of the coronavirus. The British-owned Diamond Princess cruise was quarantined in Tokyo last Monday, with 174 out of the 3,700 passengers on board now ill with the pneumonia-like illness.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, "healthy and thriving." And the World Dream was only held for four days. And the industry, uh, CLIA, they even announced they'd welcome passengers from China, Hong Kong, or Macau. No problem!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, healthy and thriving. And the World Dream was only held for four days. And the industry, uh, C L I A, they even announced they'd welcome passengers from China, Hong Kong, or Macau. No problem!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Cruise Lines International Association, the industrys trade organization, announced last week its members would bar passengers who had visited China, Hong Kong, or Macau, 14 days before their cruise, from boarding.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which, uh, brings us to the broader picture of the virus itself, which they're now calling Covid-19. Apparently, it's killed *fewer than* a thousand people and infected *fewer than* 42,000. So, like, basically nothing to worry about.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, uh, brings us to the broader picture of the virus itself, which they're now calling Covid-nineteen. Apparently, it's killed fewer than a thousand people and infected fewer than forty two thousand. So, like, basically nothing to worry about.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Coronavirus, this week renamed Covid-19, has now killed more than 1,000 people and infected at least 42,000 more.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, it's just, uh, improving so rapidly! Airlines are actually increasing flights to China, and the Lunar New Year holiday extension was meant to "encourage the spread of the virus." You know, for good measure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, it's just, uh, improving so rapidly! Airlines are actually increasing flights to China, and the Lunar New Year holiday extension was meant to encourage the spread of the virus. You know, for good measure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Airlines have also been badly disrupted, with some international carriers suspended their flights to and from China, and a number of international companies and manufacturers have been impacted by the Chinese governments move to extend the Lunar new year holiday in a bid to restrict the spread of the virus.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And, uh, tens of millions *weren't* placed under lockdown in Wuhan, where they've had the fewest reported cases. So, you know, everything's totally fine. This article is just... it's a masterpiece of, um, *information*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And, uh, tens of millions weren't placed under lockdown in Wuhan, where they've had the fewest reported cases. So, you know, everything's totally fine. This article is just it's a masterpiece of, um, information.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tens of millions were placed under lockdown by Chinese health authorities in cities like Wuhan that have seen the highest number of reported cases.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, a real, uh, clear-eyed look at the situation. It's, it's truly comforting, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, a real, uh, clear-eyed look at the situation. It's, it's truly comforting, isn't it?
